questions.question: How many UNESCO World Heritage Sites does India have?
questions.explanation: India is home to a diverse array of 43 UNESCO World Heritage Sites.

questions.question: How many of India's UNESCO sites are designated for cultural importance?
questions.explanation: 35 sites are designated for cultural importance out of India's 43 UNESCO sites.

questions.question: How many of India's UNESCO sites are recognized for natural beauty?
questions.explanation: Seven UNESCO sites in India are recognized for natural beauty.

questions.question: Which UNESCO site is praised for its blend of culture and nature?
questions.explanation: Khangchendzonga National Park is praised for its blend of culture and nature.

questions.question: How many countries boast more World Heritage Sites than India?
questions.explanation: Worldwide, only five countries boast more World Heritage Sites than India.

questions.question: Where was diamond first discovered and mined?
questions.explanation: Diamond was first discovered and mined in India.

questions.question: What is diamond called in Sanskrit?
questions.explanation: In Sanskrit, diamond was addressed as 'vajra' meaning thunderbolt.

questions.question: Early descriptions of diamond date back to which century BC?
questions.explanation: Early descriptions of diamond date back to the 4th century BC.

questions.question: India is the world's largest producer and exporter of what?
questions.explanation: India is the world's largest producer and exporter of spices.

questions.question: When was Auroville founded?
questions.explanation: Auroville was founded in 1968.

questions.question: Where is Auroville situated?
questions.explanation: Auroville is situated mostly in Tamil Nadu.

questions.question: What is special about Auroville township?
questions.explanation: Auroville welcomes citizens from all over the world and has no provisions of money or religion.

questions.question: How many post offices does Indian Postal Service have?
questions.explanation: Indian Postal Service has 154,900 post offices, the most extensive postal system in the world.

questions.question: Where is the largest number of vegetarians in the world found?
questions.explanation: The largest number of vegetarians in the world are found in India.

questions.question: How many of the world's 10 highest peaks are in the Himalayas?
questions.explanation: 9 out of 10 of the world's highest peaks are in the Himalayas mountain.

questions.question: India is the only country with a Bill of Rights for which animal?
questions.explanation: India is the only country with a Bill of Rights for cows.

questions.question: How many people does the Golden Temple serve vegetarian meals to daily?
questions.explanation: The Golden Temple in India serves a vegetarian meal to over 50,000 people a day.

questions.question: What is Siachen known as?
questions.explanation: Siachen is the world's highest battlefield.

questions.question: Dras is the world's second largest what?
questions.explanation: Dras is the world's second largest coldest inhabited place.

questions.question: India has more internet users than the entire population of which country?
questions.explanation: India has more people using the Internet than the entire population of the U.S.

questions.question: The seven states in Northeast India are collectively called what?
questions.explanation: The seven states in Northeast India are collectively called the Seven Sisters.

questions.question: Where is the centuries-old barter system still practised at Jonbeel Mela?
questions.explanation: Centuries-old barter system is still practised at Jonbeel Mela, Assam.

questions.question: Golden/Muga silk is exclusively produced in which state?
questions.explanation: Golden/Muga silk is not produced anywhere else in the world other than Assam.

questions.question: Where is Ima Keithel, the world's only women-run market, located?
questions.explanation: Ima Keithel, the world's only women-run market, is in Manipur.

questions.question: Which is the world's only floating national park?
questions.explanation: World's only floating national park Keibul Lamjao National Park is in Manipur.

questions.question: At Longwa village in Nagaland, one can be in two countries simultaneously. Which countries?
questions.explanation: At Longwa village in Nagaland, one can be simultaneously in India and Myanmar as the village is on the border.

questions.question: How many tribes and languages are there in Nagaland alone?
questions.explanation: In Nagaland alone, there are 17 tribes and 36 languages.

questions.question: What does 'Mizoram' mean?
options: Country of people living in hills
questions.answer: Country of people living in hills
questions.explanation: 'Mi' means people, 'zo' means hills, 'ram' means country - the country of people living in hills.

questions.question: What is the state flower of Mizoram?
questions.explanation: Red Vanda is the state flower of Mizoram.

questions.question: What type of farming is most common in Mizoram?
questions.explanation: The most common type of farming in Mizoram is 'Slash and Burn' or shifting cultivation.

questions.question: What is the only floating palace in Northeast India called?
questions.explanation: Tripura is home to the only floating palace in Northeast called Neer Mahal.

questions.question: Which place in India receives the first ray of the sun after Japan?
questions.explanation: Dong village in Anjaw district in Arunachal Pradesh is the first place in India to receive the first ray of the sun after Japan.

questions.question: Where is the largest monastery in India located?
questions.explanation: Arunachal Pradesh is home to the largest monastery in India - the 400-years-old Tawang Monastery.

questions.question: Tawang Monastery is the second largest in the world after which monastery?
questions.explanation: Tawang Monastery is the second largest in the world after the Potala Palace in Lhasa, Tibet.

questions.question: Meghalaya is the only state where what unique structures are made?
questions.explanation: Meghalaya is the only state where living root bridges are made.

questions.question: Where is the rainiest place in the world located?
questions.explanation: The rainiest place in the world Mawsynram is located in Meghalaya.

questions.question: How much rainfall does Mawsynram receive per year?
questions.explanation: Mawsynram village in Meghalaya receives 467 inches of rain per year.

questions.question: Who was the first Woman President of UN General Assembly?
questions.explanation: Vijaya Lakshmi Pandit was the first Woman President of UN General Assembly.

questions.question: Who was the first tribal woman to become the President of India?
questions.explanation: Draupadi Murmu was the first tribal woman to become the President of India.

questions.question: Who was India's first Woman Ambassador?
questions.explanation: C.B. Muthamma was India's first Woman Ambassador.

questions.question: Who was the first Woman Air Vice Marshal of India?
questions.explanation: Padmavathy Bandopadhyay was the first Woman Air Vice Marshal of India.

questions.question: Who was the first Woman Judge in the Supreme Court of India?
questions.explanation: M. Fathima Beevi was the first Woman Judge in the Supreme Court of India.

questions.question: Who was the first Woman Lieutenant General of India?
questions.explanation: Punita Arora was the first Woman Lieutenant General of India.

questions.question: Who was the first Indian Woman Mountaineer to scale all seven continental peaks?
questions.explanation: Premlata Agrawal was the first Indian Woman Mountaineer to scale all seven continental peaks.

questions.question: Who was the first Indian woman to ride a motorbike from Kanyakumari to Kashmir?
questions.explanation: Roshni Sharma was the first Indian woman to ride a motorbike from Kanyakumari to Kashmir.

questions.question: Which city is called the 'Boston of India'?
questions.explanation: Ahmedabad is called the Boston of India - founded by Sultan Ahmad Shah in 1411.

questions.question: When was Ahmedabad founded?
questions.explanation: Ahmedabad was founded by Sultan Ahmad Shah in 1411.

questions.question: When did Ahmedabad become India's largest industrial centre?
questions.explanation: With the opening of cotton mills in 1859, Ahmedabad became India's largest industrial centre.

questions.question: Which city is called the 'City of Nawabs'?
questions.explanation: Lucknow is called the City of Nawabs - an important railway junction on the banks of river Gomati.

questions.question: On which river's banks is Lucknow located?
questions.explanation: Lucknow is located on the banks of river Gomati.

questions.question: Which state is called the 'Land of Spices'?
questions.explanation: Kerala is called the Land of Spices - lies between Western Ghats and Arabian Sea.

questions.question: Which place is called the 'Heaven of India'?
questions.explanation: Jammu and Kashmir is called the Heaven of India - famous for beautiful gardens and Dal Lake.

questions.question: Which city is called the 'City of Seven Islands'?
questions.explanation: Mumbai is called the City of Seven Islands - India's principal port in the Arabian Sea.

questions.question: Which city is called the 'Queen of Mountains'?
questions.explanation: Mussoorie is called the Queen of Mountains - located in Uttrakhand, hometown of Ruskin Bond.

questions.question: Which famous writer's hometown is Mussoorie?
questions.explanation: Mussoorie is the hometown of famous writer Ruskin Bond.

questions.question: Which place holds the largest parade of flowers in the world?
questions.explanation: Bloemencorso in Zundert, Netherlands holds the largest parade of flowers in the world.

questions.question: How often is the Flower Carpet event in Brussels, Belgium organized?
questions.explanation: The Flower Carpet event in Brussels, Belgium is organised once in every two years.

questions.question: Batalla de Flores marks the end of which month in Valencia, Spain?
questions.explanation: Batalla de Flores marks the end of the long Feria de Julio month in Valencia, Spain.

questions.question: When is Chiang Mai Flower Festival held?
questions.explanation: Chiang Mai Flower Festival is organised on the first weekend of February.

questions.question: Which flower parade in Medellin, Colombia symbolises the end of slavery?
questions.explanation: Feria de las Flores in Medellin, Columbia symbolises the end of slavery.

questions.question: When is the Rose Parade in Pasadena, California organized?
questions.explanation: The Rose Parade in Pasadena, California is organized on every New Year's Day.

questions.question: Since when has the Genzano Infiorata Flower Festival been taking place?
questions.explanation: The Genzano Infiorata Flower Festival has been taking place for more than two centuries since 1778.

questions.question: Baju Kurung is the national dress of which countries?
questions.explanation: Baju Kurung is a traditional Malay dress and is the National Dress for Brunei and Malaysia.

questions.question: Dirndl is traditionally worn by women of which countries?
questions.explanation: Dirndl is worn with a long skirt, shirt, bodice and apron by women of Germany, Austria, Switzerland and Liechtenstein.

questions.question: Traje de Flamenca is worn by dancers in which country?
questions.explanation: Traje de Flamenca is worn by the Flamenco dancers in Spain.

questions.question: Muumuu is a formal clothing worn during festivals and weddings in which place?
questions.explanation: Muumuu is formal clothing worn during occasional parties, festivals and weddings in Hawaii.

questions.question: Kimono is traditionally worn in which country?
questions.explanation: Kimono is worn by the Japanese during cultural events and weddings - a long T-shaped dress.

questions.question: Ao Dai is a traditional costume of which country?
questions.explanation: Ao Dai is a Vietnamese costume - a tight outfit made of complete silk material.

questions.question: What is Cheongsam also known as?
questions.explanation: Cheongsam is also known as the Mandarin gown - popular among Chinese men and women.

questions.question: Sinh is a traditional garment worn by women in which countries?
questions.explanation: Sinh is a traditional garment worn by Lao and Thai women in Laos and Thailand.

questions.question: Chami Murmu is an environmental activist from which state?
questions.explanation: Chami Murmu is an environmental activist from Saraikela Kharsawan district of Jharkhand.

questions.question: What organisation did Chami Murmu set up?
questions.explanation: Chami Murmu formed a network of women and set up her organisation 'Sahayogi Mahila'.

questions.question: In which year was Chami Murmu awarded the Indira Priyadarshini Vrikshamitra Puraskar?
questions.explanation: Chami Murmu was awarded the Indira Priyadarshini Vrikshamitra Puraskar in 2019.

questions.question: In which year was Chami Murmu conferred with the Padma Shri award?
questions.explanation: Chami Murmu was conferred with the Padma Shri award in 2024.

questions.question: Dukhu Majhi is an environmental activist from which village?
questions.explanation: Dukhu Majhi is an environmental activist from Sindri village in West Bengal's Purulia district.

questions.question: What is Dukhu Majhi affectionately known as?
questions.explanation: Dukhu Majhi is affectionately known as 'Gachh Dadu' (Tree Grandpa).

questions.question: At what age does Dukhu Majhi continue to plant trees?
questions.explanation: At 78, Dukhu Majhi continues to plant trees at rural markets, bus stands, roadsides, etc.

questions.question: What invention did 11-year-old Anirudh Rao create?
questions.explanation: Anirudh Rao is the young mind behind the Tornado Early Warning System invention.

questions.question: What is Anirudh Rao's prototype tornado warning device called?
questions.explanation: Anirudh Rao's prototype is named 'Revere' - a blend of drones and sensors.

questions.question: Licypriya Kangujam is an environmental activist from which state?
questions.explanation: Licypriya Kangujam is a passionate environmental activist from Manipur.

questions.question: What innovative initiative did Licypriya Kangujam start in 2022?
questions.explanation: Licypriya initiated the 'Plastic Money Shop' in 2022 - a mobile, solar-powered shop.

questions.question: Kiara Kaur started her environmental journey at what age?
questions.explanation: Kiara Kaur embarked on her path as an environmentalist at the tender age of 3.

questions.question: Kiara Kaur was one of the youngest speakers at which UN Climate conference?
questions.explanation: Kiara Kaur was recognized as one of the youngest speakers at COY18 and COP28.

questions.question: What initiative did Tejas Pugalia spearhead?
questions.explanation: Tejas Pugalia spearheaded the impactful initiative called 'Threads 4 Good'.

questions.question: How many school bags has Threads 4 Good crafted from discarded clothing?
questions.explanation: Threads 4 Good has crafted over 5,000 school bags from approximately 8,400 pieces of discarded clothing.

questions.question: What electronic waste initiative did Sahithi Radha create?
questions.explanation: Sahithi Radha created E-CYCL-India, an electronic waste recycling and awareness initiative.

questions.question: How much e-waste has Sahithi Radha's initiative helped recycle?
questions.explanation: Sahithi Radha's initiative has facilitated the recycling of over 10,000 kilograms of e-waste.

questions.question: What initiative did Veer Mehta create for marine conservation?
questions.explanation: Veer Mehta created 'Turning the Tide' - a data-driven initiative for marine pollution detection.

questions.question: What are the six main ways for waste disposal?
options: Burning, burying, throwing, dumping, hiding, ignoring
Preventing, recycling, incineration, composting, landfill, reuse
questions.answer: Preventing, recycling, incineration, composting, landfill, reuse
questions.explanation: There are six main ways for waste disposal: preventing, recycling, incineration, composting, landfill, and reuse.

questions.question: What percentage of waste is recyclable?
questions.explanation: Over 75% of waste is recyclable, but we only recycle about 30% of it.

questions.question: What percentage of waste do we actually recycle?
questions.explanation: We only recycle about 30% of waste even though over 75% is recyclable.

questions.question: How long does it take for an aluminum can to return to the shop floor after recycling?
questions.explanation: An aluminum can placed for recycling can be back on the shop floor in 3 weeks.

questions.question: Recycling 100 cans could light your bedroom for how long?
questions.explanation: Recycling 100 cans could light your bedroom for 2 whole weeks.

questions.question: By how much has paper recycling increased since 1990?
questions.explanation: Paper recycling has increased over 89% since 1990.

questions.question: Which Hindu festival had world's largest gathering of 660 million people?
questions.explanation: Kumbh Festival had the world's largest gathering of 660 million people taking a holy dip in the Ganga.

questions.question: Who is the second Indian astronaut to go to space after Rakesh Sharma?
questions.explanation: Shubhanshu Shukla is the second Indian astronaut to go to space after Rakesh Sharma.

questions.question: Which country created an artificial Sun?
questions.explanation: China created an artificial Sun.

questions.question: What is the Oxford Dictionary Word of the Year?
questions.explanation: Ragebait is the Oxford Dictionary Word of the Year.

questions.question: Who won the 2025 F1 Championship?
questions.explanation: Lando Norris is the 2025 F1 Champion.

questions.question: Which city will host the Commonwealth Games 2030?
questions.explanation: Ahmedabad will be the host city for Commonwealth Games 2030.

questions.question: Who is the new Chief Justice of India?
questions.explanation: Justice Suryakant is the new Chief Justice of India.

questions.question: Where will the world's first Sky Stadium be built?
questions.explanation: The world's first Sky Stadium will be built in Saudi Arabia.

questions.question: Which country won the ICC Women's Cricket World Cup?
questions.explanation: India won the ICC Women's Cricket World Cup.

questions.question: In which country were mosquitoes discovered for the first time in 2025?
questions.explanation: Mosquitoes were discovered for the first time in Iceland in 2025.

questions.question: Which country has appointed the first AI minister?
questions.explanation: Albania has appointed the first AI minister.

questions.question: Which is the cleanest city of India for the 8th consecutive time?
questions.explanation: Indore is the cleanest city of India for the 8th consecutive time.

questions.question: Who won IPL 2025?
questions.explanation: Royal Challengers Bangalore won IPL 2025.

questions.question: Who is the Vice President of USA?
questions.explanation: JD Vance is the Vice President of USA.

questions.question: Which band has the record of highest attended music tour in history?
questions.explanation: Coldplay has the record of the highest attended music tour in history.

questions.question: Babies born between 2025 and 2039 belong to which generation?
questions.explanation: Babies born between 2025 and 2039 belong to Generation Beta.

questions.question: The best way to store a toothbrush is under a cap. True or False?
questions.explanation: The best way to store a toothbrush is NOT under a cap - it needs air to dry.

questions.question: Gum disease has been shown to be associated with:
questions.explanation: Gum disease has been shown to be associated with heart disease, diabetes, and pregnancy.

questions.question: What is the most common cause of dry mouth?
questions.explanation: Medications are the most common cause of dry mouth.

questions.question: Hard toothbrush bristles are more effective than soft because tooth plaque is hard. True or False?
questions.explanation: This is false - soft bristles are recommended as plaque is soft and easily removed.

questions.question: How many teeth exist in the normal adult mouth (including wisdom teeth)?
questions.explanation: 32 teeth exist in the normal adult mouth including wisdom teeth.

questions.question: What fraction of the normal tooth is below the gumline?
questions.explanation: 2/3 of the normal tooth is below the gumline.

questions.question: How often should a toothbrush be changed?
options: At the close of every illness
Once every two or three months
questions.answer: Once every two or three months
questions.explanation: A toothbrush should be changed once every two or three months.

questions.question: When should mouthwash be used?
questions.explanation: Mouthwash should be used before brushing.

questions.question: Ramveer Tanwar from Greater Noida has saved how many ponds in the past five years?
questions.explanation: Ramveer Tanwar has saved ten ponds in the past five years by reviving small ponds.

questions.question: What initiative did Ramveer Tanwar start to create water awareness?
questions.explanation: Ramveer Tanwar started organising Jal-chaupals to create water awareness.

questions.question: Shadab Hassan established which school in Brambe village, Jharkhand?
questions.explanation: Shadab Hassan established the Hamid Hassan High School (HHHS) in Brambe village.

questions.question: How far is Brambe village from Ranchi in Jharkhand?
questions.explanation: Brambe is a small village 20 kms from Ranchi in Jharkhand.

questions.question: Dr. Bharat Saran's coaching institute provides free medical education to how many students?
options: 25 students from Class 11 and 25 from Class 12
questions.answer: 25 students from Class 11 and 25 from Class 12
questions.explanation: Dr. Bharat Saran provides free medical education to 25 underprivileged students from Class 11 and 25 from Class 12.

questions.question: What is Dr. Bharat Saran's coaching institute called?
questions.explanation: Dr. Bharat Saran opened a coaching institute named 50 Villagers Seva Sansthan.

questions.question: Who is the Finance Minister of India?
questions.explanation: Smt. Nirmala Sitharaman is the Finance Minister of India.

questions.question: Who is the Minister of Home Affairs of India?
questions.explanation: Shri Amit Shah is the Minister of Home Affairs of India.

questions.question: Who is the Defence Minister of India?
questions.explanation: Shri Raj Nath Singh is the Defence Minister of India.

questions.question: Who is the Education Minister of India?
questions.explanation: Shri Dharmendra Pradhan is the Education Minister of India.

questions.question: When is International Yoga Day celebrated?
questions.explanation: International Yoga Day is celebrated on 21st June.

questions.question: When is World Wildlife Day celebrated?
questions.explanation: World Wildlife Day is celebrated on 3rd March.
